title: Key & Peele -  Sex with Black Guys

comments.text:

racism, while simultaneously rejecting the bad parts? Because I feel like 
the biggest joke was that the women were incredibly racist, but I also find 
it odd that Key and Peele were still agreeing with them whenever they 
suggested that black men were better at having sex.﻿

Racial prejudice, at the root of porn fantasy, is reproduced and 
perpetuated on powerful stereotypes: Black males are dangerous, tough, 
sex-starved and have big dicks they'll stick anywhere. White women are 
cheap whores who despise and fear black men but want their big black dicks 
until they orgasm. The makers of this video are clearly parodying 
stereotypes rather than affirming them, but wrong-headed people like Samuel 
L. Jackson, whose "impressions" about race relations are formed from 
messages about race he receives from porn, will claim that this parody is, 
in his words, " depicted".."as real", presumably because that's the only 
"reality" he knows. Anyone possessing social experience with interracial 
couples knows that what porn represents as "truth" is not anything like the 
"truth". The stereotypes are demeaning, dehumanizing. My appeal is for 
right-minded people to call shit on, or at least not be influenced by, the 
"masters of illusion" on this thread. If you want to know about interracial 
relations, ask those who are actually in them. OK, I'm through.﻿

comments.text:
Since the 1960s scientists have understood race as a social construct 
imposed on phenotypes in culturally determined ways, rather than a 
biological concept. A 2000 study by Celera Genomics found that human DNA 
does not differ significantly across populations. Citizens of any village 
in the world, in Scotland or Tanzania, have 90 percent of the genetic 
variability humanity has to offer. Only .01 percent of genes account for a 
person's appearance.[15]Biological adaptation plays a role in bodily 
features and skin type. According to Luigi Luca Cavalli-Sforza, "From a 
scientific point of view, the concept of race has failed to obtain any 
consensus; none is likely, given the gradual variation in existence. It may 
be objected that the racial stereotypes have a consistency that allows even 
the layman to classify individuals. However, the major stereotypes, all 
based on skin color, hair color and form, and facial traits, reflect 
superficial differences that are not confirmed by deeper analysis with more 
reliable genetic traits and whose origin dates from recent evolution mostly 
under the effect of climate and perhaps sexual selection".[﻿
